text: BANGKOK, April 12 Thailands central bank will allow registration for non-resident bond investors by Jan. 4 next year, it said on Monday, in order to enhance market surveillance to safeguard exchange rate stability and financial stability.The step requires investors pre-register for authentication before trading bonds, and trading must be settled through accounts registered with the central bank, the Bank of Thailand said in a statement. (bit.ly/32aF93m)The rule is part of a series of measures announced late last year aimed at balancing fund flows.
